title: Website with MetaMask support does not work with Status Wallet
body:
# Bug Report

_I assume that we aim for Status Wallet to work with all dApps, even if they display MetaMask support only_

This is related to an NFT claim that seem to have worked for several other users (presumably using MetaMask).

## Problem 

1. Open https://www.iwwon.com/newworldorder
2. Click on "Cyrptomories Owners"
3. Tap "Sign In" on "Sign to Metamask" modal
4. tap "Allow"
5. Tap "Cryptomories Owners"
6. Select Morie
7. Tap "Claim 1"

#### Expected behavior

8. Open window to sign action

#### Actual behavior

8. Nothing happens

### Reproduction

Please let me know if I can do anything to provide more details.

### Additional Information

- Status version: 1.18.2
- Operating System: Android

![Screenshot_20220221-100644.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/154868472-41249b40-82cf-458c-b355-14e817b3ce22.jpg)
![Screenshot_20220221-100651.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/154868476-3c421e57-6e60-4a14-9637-ae5868480f6c.jpg)
![Screenshot_20220221-100656.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/154868478-b898c5b4-6351-4a7b-a3fb-d46ac8dcae09.jpg)
![Screenshot_20220221-100837.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/154868482-e6a5b6d9-b0af-47b0-805c-025e34e2fa2e.jpg)

Maybe it's more of a wider issue. I am getting the same problem with collabland.![Screenshot_20220221-103449.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/154869363-ab2b721c-9177-43f1-84dd-4dd46d562634.jpg)

The popup to sign never appears. My account is a keycard one.
> Tap "Claim 1" can't find this option

> can't find this option

you have to own, that's why this issue is not easy to fix, because it's not easy to replicate it

The collabland issue, that seem similar but of course we can't know for sure if it's the same, is easier to replicate:

1. Got to iwwon Discord: https://discord.com/channels/833666166915596309/833666167381688351 (link on bottom of page https://www.iwwon.com/)
2. Go to #collabland-join channel
3. Click "Let's go"
4. try to go through the collabland process with Status Mobile, Android App, with keycard.

(4) Does not work for me as the popup to sign a message to verify Ethereum address ownership does not pop up.

1. Go to the collabland invite link provided by (4) above
![Screenshot_20220224-101206.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/155425233-4d5e946c-7d4f-40a6-9889-3c63f6de2e1d.jpg)
2. Click "MetaMask"
![Screenshot_20220224-101211.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/155425242-9d620f5b-16df-4617-ae0e-480545b470c8.jpg)
3. Click "Sign Message"
![Screenshot_20220224-101216.jpg](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/300805/155425246-5bcfa064-ce4a-411f-a4b9-a4abf9655475.jpg)
4. Enjoy the wheel of death :clown_face:
thanks a lot for the detailed steps, I'll try to replicate
strange, if i open the discord link, i have this

Did you try from https://www.iwwon.com? 
What's your Discord? I am fryorcraken.eth#3296 let's chat to resolve this.
I was able to reproduce the issue by simply going to https://connect.collab.land/

ok for collab.land it looks weird
```
request: {"method":{"method":"eth_signTypedData_v4","params":["0x2Ac3c022c92Ec01beff8Df4E534588a6aB30322A","{\"domain\":{\"chainId\":1,\"name\":\"Collab.Land Connect\",\"verifyingContract\":\"0xCcCCccccCCCCcCCCCCCcCcCccCcCCCcCcccccccC\",\"version\":\"1\"},\"primaryType\":\"Verify\",\"message\":{\"message\":\"Verify account ownership\"},\"types\":{\"EIP712Domain\":[{\"name\":\"name\",\"type\":\"string\"},{\"name\":\"version\",\"type\":\"string\"},{\"name\":\"chainId\",\"type\":\"uint256\"},{\"name\":\"verifyingContract\",\"type\":\"address\"}],\"Verify\":[{\"name\":\"message\",\"type\":\"string\"}]}}"],"from":"0x2Ac3c022c92Ec01beff8Df4E534588a6aB30322A"}}
```
`{"method":{"method"` thats why it doesn't work in status
i'll look into it :)
hey @qfrank i think we shouldn't "fix" `{"method":{"method"` in status. it should be fixed in the dapp
Can we try to investigate [iwwon](https://www.iwwon.com/newworldorder)? How can I help with this one.
last time i tried it , discord link didn't work for me
@D4nte could you try to get dapp logs ?  you need to enable webview debug in advanced, and connect chrome to dapp for debug
if you need any help ping me in discord , thanks

> The collabland issue, that seem similar but of course we can't know for sure if it's the same, is easier to replicate:
> 
> 1. Got to iwwon Discord: https://discord.com/channels/833666166915596309/833666167381688351 (link on bottom of page https://www.iwwon.com/)
> 2. Go to #collabland-join channel
> 3. Click "Let's go"
> 4. try to go through the collabland process with Status Mobile, Android App, with keycard.
> 
> (4) Does not work for me as the popup to sign a message to verify Ethereum address ownership does not pop up.

Hi @D4nte , the link looks like broken

@D4nte Hi! Could you please check if you are still reproducing the bug on https://www.iwwon.com/newworldorder using this [apk](https://status-im-prs.ams3.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-Mobile-220726-064521-d919b0-pr13724-universal.apk) ?

I've already checked it on https://connect.collab.land/ and signing pop up appears. Although the sign action itself fails but as was described [above](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/issues/13121#issuecomment-1195018272) by @qfrank  the same behaviour happens to Metamask Wallet, so this is not Status related issue.

> 

It does not help unfortunately.

I just noticed it's possible to check the code on iwwon: 

https://www.iwwon.com/static/js/section/4-NewWorldOrderSection/NewWorldOrderSection.js

I wonder if line 394 is the culprit as I do not see a snack bar when I click on the claim btn:

```
 const retVal = await WriteBC(contractABI,contractAddress,'moriesOwnerClaimNTokens',0,[claimTokenArray]);
```

Will try to get debug logs
if i can't reproduce, hard to solve, the debug logs didn't help much :)

> Alright, I was able to get some debug logs:
> 
> ```
> interact.js:108 Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'currentProvider')
>    at interact.js:108:34
>    at f (runtime.js:63:40)
>    at Generator._invoke (runtime.js:293:22)
>    at Generator.next (runtime.js:118:21)
>    at n (asyncToGenerator.js:3:20)
>    at s (asyncToGenerator.js:25:9)
>    at asyncToGenerator.js:32:7
>    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
>    at asyncToGenerator.js:21:12
>    at interact.js:106:21
> ```
> 
> When clicking on claim1.
> 
> this comes from `interact.js`:
> 
> ```
> export const WriteBC = async(contractABI,contractAddress,fn,dummy,args) => {
>   //alert("interact-WriteBC fn= " + fn + " nboftoken " + nbOfToken) ;
>   var web3Provider = window.web3.currentProvider; // !!! LOOKS LIKE THIS IS THE ISSUE. `currentProvider` is undefined
>   var web3 = new Web3(window.ethereum);
>   const myContract = await new web3.eth.Contract(contractABI, contractAddress);
>   const nonce = await web3.eth.getTransactionCount(window.ethereum.selectedAddress, 'latest'); //get latest nonce
>   var tokenPrice=0;
>  
>   //the transaction
>       const tx = {
>         'from': window.ethereum.selectedAddress,
>         'to': contractAddress,
>         'nonce': nonce.toString(),
>         'value':  0,
>         'data': myContract.methods[fn].apply(this,args).encodeABI()
>       };
> 
>       //'gas': (2000000).toString(),
> //sign the transaction via Metamask
> try {
>   console.log("value "+ tx.value);
>   const txHash = await window.ethereum
>     .request({
>         method: 'eth_sendTransaction',
>         params: [tx],
>     });
>   return {
>     success: true,
>     status: "Transaction hash :" + txHash
>   }
>   } catch (error) {
>   return {
>     success: false,
>     status: " Something went wrong: " + error.message
>   }
>   
>   }
> }
> ```
if it's really because `window.web3.currentProvider`, i'd say status browser does not support the property `window.web3`, `web3` has known security issues ( source: https://docs.metamask.io/guide/provider-migration.html#replacing-window-web3 ), i guess status won't like to support neither, metamask suggest that "if you just want your web3 site to continue to work, we created [@metamask/legacy-web3](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/legacy-web3)"

> if it's really because `window.web3.currentProvider`, i'd say status browser does not support the property `window.web3`, `web3` has known security issues ( source: [docs.metamask.io/guide/provider-migration.html#replacing-window-web3](https://docs.metamask.io/guide/provider-migration.html#replacing-window-web3) ), i guess status won't like to support neither, metamask suggest that "if you just want your web3 site to continue to work, we created [@metamask/legacy-web3](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/legacy-web3)"

Thanks for that. I forwarded to the dApp developer. Fair enough if no action is taken on Status side.
